results.title: Bringing me home
results.creator_credit: Karen Greer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Mitchell River is the largest unregulated river in Victoria. To Karen Greer, it is her home and ever since childhood, she has navigated the waters and continues tracing the river upstream.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karen Greer, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: The Mitchell River is the largest unregulated river in Victoria. To Karen Greer, it is her home and ever since childhood, she has navigated the waters and continues tracing the river upstream.

results.title: Pitcha this : Stories from the windy wanderers : Digital Storytelling workshop
results.brief_description: Nine stories from members of the Indigenous community in Heywood in south-western Victoria. The stories, while providing an insight into the treatment of Indigenous people in Australia, are mostly personal accounts of what it is that keeps these particular people spiritually connected, whether it be the land or the people they love.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : Stories from the windy wanderers : Digital Storytelling workshop
results.description: Nine stories from members of the Indigenous community in Heywood in south-western Victoria. The stories, while providing an insight into the treatment of Indigenous people in Australia, are mostly personal accounts of what it is that keeps these particular people spiritually connected, whether it be the land or the people they love.
description_for_label: Nine stories from members of the Indigenous community in Heywood in south-western Victoria. The stories, while providing an insight into the treatment of Indigenous people in Australia, are mostly personal accounts of what it is that keeps these particular people spiritually connected, whether it be the land or the people they love.

results.title: These things I still question
results.creator_credit: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.

results.title: Home, the old place, Little Dunmore
results.creator_credit: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eileen Alberts remembers the home of her past, her family’s history and her spiritual home. It is the place that has made her the person she is and where she returns to soothe her soul and strengthen her spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Eileen Alberts remembers the home of her past, her family’s history and her spiritual home. It is the place that has made her the person she is and where she returns to soothe her soul and strengthen her spirit.

results.title: Home country
results.creator_credit: Julie Mongta-Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Julie Mongta/Saunders traces the movement of her family over time, both geographically and generationally. Though scattered, this family have a strong connection, both to each other and the land of their birth, intensified by the sense of ‘coming home’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julie Mongta-Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Julie Mongta/Saunders traces the movement of her family over time, both geographically and generationally. Though scattered, this family have a strong connection, both to each other and the land of their birth, intensified by the sense of ‘coming home’.

results.creator_credit: Laura Bell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Laura Bell reflects on her life through the things that have made her proud. Bell’s family, her community and her achievements are what keep her driven and passionate about her work.
